movie_title: North Korea’s secrets revealed by phone: Study: BBC Learning English from the News
introduction: A phone smuggled out of North Korea has revealed how Kin Jong-un’s government controls things in the

vocabulary.example: The phone was smuggled out of North Korea to reveal its secrets.

vocabulary.definition: a software feature that automatically corrects misspelled words as they are typed
vocabulary.example: The North Korean phone's autocorrect changes words to fit the government's beliefs.

vocabulary.definition: a government, especially an authoritarian one
vocabulary.example: Kim Jong Un's regime in North Korea tightly controls information.

vocabulary.definition: using a figure of speech in which a word or phrase is applied to an object or action to which it is not literally applicable
vocabulary.example: In the headline, 'wild' is used metaphorically to describe the North Korean phone.

vocabulary.definition: to set apart or cut off from others
vocabulary.example: North Korea is isolated from the rest of the world, limiting information flow.

vocabulary.definition: full of life and energy; active and outgoing
vocabulary.example: The party was lively with music and dancing all night.
